result.execSummary:
The defendant Danira Shantee Cameron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: With credit for 3 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.  Cash bail from 15CM417 to apply.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Maintain full time employment or attend school.

Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Mental health assessment, comply with all recommended treatment.

No Violent Contact with the victims.
No physical discipline of any child.

Complete an anger management course.
Complete a parenting class.
Cooperate with all CHIPS orders.
Cooperate fully with probation agent.

AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs or alcohol.
Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: STAYED, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danira Shantee Cameron

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Danira Shantee Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 33 MONTHS, with credit for 3 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 60 days  in the House of Correction, STAYED, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent.
-Complete an anger management course.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Mental health assessment, comply with all recommended treatment.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random urine screens.
-No Violent Contact with the victims.
-No physical discipline of any child.
-Cooperate with all CHIPS orders.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment or attend school.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.  Cash bail from 15CM417 to apply.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Court ordered the no-contact order be modified and amended to a no violent contact order. All other conditions as to bond will continue and all conditions as to contact as ordered by children's court be followed.

Defendant Danira S Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for sentencing. Court ordered case adjourned in branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Danira Shantee Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Sarra Mae Kiaie for Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Danira Shantee Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk:  rmm.
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danira Shantee Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/08/15 in Branch 40.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 15CM417 and 15CF595 joined for the purpose of trial.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
State's Motion for Joinder received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Defendant Danira Shantee Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  State to file motion for joinder by 4/20/15; defense to file response by 5/11/15.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danira Shantee Cameron in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for plea hearing.  Counsel informed Court there a conflict.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danira Shantee Cameron in court with attorney Alexis B Luster.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.W. (3/28/2009) or S.T. (4/30/2009) unless the contact is supervised by the BMCW.

Defendant Danira Shantee Cameron in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Danira Shantee Cameron in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
